meanings.definition: A small insect with long antennae and legs, typically found in dark and damp places.
meanings.sent1: I saw caroaches crawling in the kitchen last night.
meanings.sent2: The caroaches scurried away when the light turned on.
meanings.sent3: The caroaches were having a party in the pantry!
meanings.sent4: The caroaches in the basement seemed to multiply overnight.
meanings.sent5: The sight of caroaches made my skin crawl.

meanings.definition: To be repulsed or disgusted by something.
meanings.sent1: She caroaches at the thought of eating snails.
meanings.sent2: I caroach at the sight of spoiled milk.
meanings.sent3: He always caroaches when he sees someone chewing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The smell of rotten eggs made her caroach uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the medicine made him caroach in disgust.
